events.event_description: Constellation Energy announced a 20-year power purchase agreement to provide electricity to Microsoft data centers from the Three Mile Island Unit 1 nuclear reactor.
events.citation: Last month, Constellation Energy announced a 20-year power purchase agreement (PPA) to provide electricity to Microsoft data centers in the mid-Atlantic region from the Unit 1 reactor at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania.

events.event_description: Amazon Web Services signed a contract for 960 megawatts of capacity from Talen Energy's Susquehanna nuclear power plant.
events.citation: In March, Amazon Web Services (AWS) signed a contract for 960 megawatts (MW) of capacity from Talen Energy's Susquehanna nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania.

events.event_description: Three Mile Island Unit 1 was retired due to profitability concerns under then-operator Exelon.
events.citation: Unit 1 had returned to operation in 1985 after the 1979 partial meltdown that affected the adjacent Unit 2, but it was retired in 2019 because then-operator Exelon said it was no longer profitable.

events.event_description: Constellation announced plans to restart Three Mile Island Unit 1 with significant upgrades to systems and equipment, aiming to extend operations until 2054.
events.citation: According to Constellation, restarting will require significant investment at the plant, including upgrades to multiple systems and equipment. In the agreement announced on September 20, Constellation said it is aiming to reopen Three Mile Island Unit 1 sometime in 2028.
